title: How much prize money will the Wimbledon champion earn?
description: Jannik Sinner and Carlos Alcaraz will meet Sunday in the Wimbledon final, one of the most highly anticipated matches in recent memory. Alcaraz recently saved three championship points to battle past Sinner in a memorable Roland Garros final. Fans have been waiting for their rematch ever since. Both men are keen to lift another Grand Slam trophy, but there will be more at stake Sunday on Centre Court. The winner will earn a significant addition to their tournament prize money. The Wimbledon champion will claim £3,000,000, while the runner-up will earn £1,520,000. Look below for a full prize-money breakdown of the singles fields at the grass-court major. 2025 Wimbledon Singles Prize Money (Men & Women) Round Prize Money   Champion  £3,000,000  Finalist  £1,520,000  Semi-finalist  £775,000  Quarter-finalist  £400,000  R16  £240,000  R32   £152,000  R64   £99,000  R128   £66,000 More On Wimbledon Final Rivalries: Alcaraz vs. Sinner What time is the Alcaraz-Sinner final? Poll: Vote for your pick in the blockbuster Alcaraz-Sinner championship clash [NEWSLETTER FORM]
excerpt: Jannik Sinner and Carlos Alcaraz will meet Sunday in the Wimbledon final, one of the most highly anticipated matches in recent memory. How much prize money will the champion earn?
text: Wimbledon World No. 1 Sinner plays two-time defending champion Alcaraz for the title July 12, 2025 AFP/Getty Images The Wimbledon final will be played Sunday on Centre Court. Alcaraz recently saved three championship points to battle past Sinner in a memorable Roland Garros final. Fans have been waiting for their rematch ever since. Both men are keen to lift another Grand Slam trophy, but there will be more at stake Sunday on Centre Court. The winner will earn a significant addition to their tournament prize money. The Wimbledon champion will claim £3,000,000, while the runner-up will earn £1,520,000. html:
Wimbledon

World No. 1 Sinner plays two-time defending champion Alcaraz for the title

July 12, 2025

AFP/Getty Images

The Wimbledon final will be played Sunday on Centre Court. By ATP Staff

Jannik Sinner and Carlos Alcaraz will meet Sunday in the Wimbledon final, one of the most highly anticipated matches in recent memory.

Alcaraz recently saved three championship points to battle past Sinner in a memorable Roland Garros final. Fans have been waiting for their rematch ever since.

Both men are keen to lift another Grand Slam trophy, but there will be more at stake Sunday on Centre Court. The winner will earn a significant addition to their tournament prize money.

The Wimbledon champion will claim £3,000,000, while the runner-up will earn £1,520,000. Look below for a full prize-money breakdown of the singles fields at the grass-court major.

2025 Wimbledon Singles Prize Money (Men & Women)

Round Prize Money 
 Champion  £3,000,000
 Finalist  £1,520,000
 Semi-finalist  £775,000
 Quarter-finalist  £400,000
 R16  £240,000
 R32   £152,000
 R64   £99,000
 R128   £66,000
